oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Estimating bioavailable reserves and potential leaching of soil P by simple chemical tests
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Saarela, Into
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nutrient turnover
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The amounts of P extracted with acid ammonium acetate are significantly correlated with the bioavailable P reserves of Finnish soils. Together with clay percentage the simple extraction method is fairly reliable. In routine soil testing clay% can be estimated visually. Additional improvement in accuracy is possible by extraction with a strong acid. Leaching losses of P are also significantly correlated with acetate-extractable soil P, but the concentration of dissolved phosphate at a certain soil test P value varies with other soil properties and increases with decreasing pH.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Saarela, Into (2008) Estimating bioavailable reserves and potential leaching of soil P by simple chemical tests. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 4 (4), pp. 166-170.
